channel.title: [Help] Making Shopkeepers not be able to walk through objects [PI]
channel.description: Hi, I'm currently working on a blank base of [shadow=purple,left]Project Insanity[/shadow] and am trying to make Shopkeepers or NPC'S in general not be able to walk through objects. Does anyone know where I can begin, or what to do? Will help me a ton, thank you!

item.title: [Help] Making Shopkeepers not be able to walk through objects [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Vhenom Vhenom
item.description:
@Vhenom wrote:

Alright I got it working, I was getting errors because I was missing another bracket thanks man. But can you see about helping me with my other thread? The one with the infinite amounts?

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] Making Shopkeepers not be able to walk through objects [PI]
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

public static void npcRandomWalk(int i) { if (Misc.random(6) == 1 && !npcs[i].walkingHome) { int MoveX = 0; int MoveY = 0; int Rnd = Misc.random(9); if (Rnd == 1) { MoveX = 1; MoveY = 1; } else if (Rnd == 2) { MoveX = -1; } else if (Rnd == 3) { MoveY = -1; } else if (Rnd == 4) { MoveX = 1; } else if (Rnd == 5) { MoveY = 1; } else if (Rnd == 6) { MoveX = -1; MoveY = -1; } else if (Rnd == 7) { MoveX = -1; MoveY = 1; } else if (Rnd == 8) { MoveX = 1; MoveY = -1; } if (MoveX == 1) { if (npcs[i].absX + MoveX < npcs[i].makeX + 1) { npcs[i].moveX = 1; } else { npcs[i].moveX = 0; } } if (MoveX == -1) { if (npcs[i].absX - MoveX > npcs[i].makeX - 1) { npcs[i].moveX = -1; } else { npcs[i].moveX = 0; } } if (MoveY == 1) { if (npcs[i].absY + MoveY < npcs[i].makeY + 1) { npcs[i].moveY = 1; } else { npcs[i].moveY = 0; } } if (MoveY == -1) { if (npcs[i].absY - MoveY > npcs[i].makeY - 1) { npcs[i].moveY = -1; } else { npcs[i].moveY = 0; } } final int x = npcs[i].getX() + npcs[i].moveX; final int y = npcs[i].getY() + npcs[i].moveY; boolean canWalk = Region.getClipping(x, y, npcs[i].heightLevel, npcs[i].moveX, npcs[i].moveY); for (int p = 0; p < maxNPCs; p++) { if (npcs[p] == null) { continue; } if (npcs[p].absX == npcs[i].absX + npcs[i].moveX && npcs[p].absY == npcs[i].absY + npcs[i].moveY) { npcs[i].moveX = 0; npcs[i].moveY = 0; break; } } if (canWalk) { npcs[i].getNextNPCMovement(i); } else { npcs[i].moveX = 0; npcs[i].moveY = 0; } npcs[i].updateRequired = true; } }

and under walkingtype in process you would call that instead

Read full topic
